abstract.p: Kate Spade designs new Play Dates datebook made of pink calfskin; photo (Pulse column) (S)

block.p: Necessity, according to conventional wisdom, is the mother of invention. But as every parent knows -- whether faced with a fractious toddler or a churlish teenager -- invention is frequently a mother's necessity. So, on Mother's Day, next Sunday, it seems only right to celebrate Mom's creativity by choosing a gift that tweaks the mold with wit and practicality. Here are some new variations on tried-and-true themes, for families of all ages.

The Mommy Track: A Timetable Instead of a date-book, give her Kate Spade's new Play Dates book ($40 at Kate Spade), a sweet way to schedule recreational stops on the mommy track. The pink calfskin agenda has blank pages for appointments; competitive mothers can make notes in margins.
